data.title: not a palace but food is fit for royals
data.text: The place has no frills but the food is special and full of exotic spices blended in a way that stimulates taste buds you didn't know about.  Take your time relishing it.  The servers like Sundarshan are highly dependable and the chefs like Suman are very skilled.  Everything in Udupi Palace centers around the food and making it ihealthy and tasty.  If you want nice decor, go to a museum afterwards.  I'm an aristocrat and I dined better at Udupi than at many a palace banquet.

data.title: Dropping my niece to UCB
data.text: So we missed the lunch hour venues in and around her dorm. So when we saw this place open after 3pm we went in. My sister, my niece and I were very hungry. Place was small, the waiter immediately greeted us and asked if we wanted any beverage. We all tried each of their Udupi specials. Yummy, the food was great. the use of coconut complimented all of our dishes. We had different sauces but we all tasted each others. I am telling you it was a feast and the 3 of us enjoyed it very much. Lots of laughter around the meal. It was great.

data.title: Great
data.text: Felt authentic, wonderful spices, tasted good, big portions, lots of options, although it is a little small. You should definently try it out!

data.title: Delicious Dosas
data.text: Typical hot, greasy, satisfying Indian Dosa.  I find dosas hard to come by and was delighted with the variety of vegetarian dosas available. Great chai too.

data.title: Very disappointed
data.text: We have been going to Udupi Palace for years but last week it was thoroughly disappointed. The masala dosa was soggy and the filling was tasteless. The thali was so-so. It is hard to find good South Indian food in the East bay and this was our "go to" place. The dosa at Vik's is a lot better and if you want a more posh experience, for almost the same cost you can go to Dosa in San Francisco!

data.title: dinner
data.text: we arrived in Berkeley after a long flight from the UK and decided to have dinner here - it was an excellent choice as the food was  lovely and light and great value/taste and nice and quick! It's quite a basic restaurant but had a nice family atmosphere with lots of south indians eating there which is always a good sign!

data.title: Where else can you get Paper Dosa?
data.text:
Paper Dosa are very rare in Indian restaurants in the USA.  They are mostly from way south India,
Beyond the novelty of paper dosa,  it is an ok place to have some masala dosa or,, thali,  They do have sweet and salty and mango lassi,, i do not like them sweet so , i do not like it at places that only have mango lassi.

data.title: Greatest South Indian ever
data.text:
Wow is the only word when it comes to having south Indian food at Udupi.
Had to wait a bit and but lemme tell u ...it was worth the wait. 

Awesome food ,great service and tastiest south Indian ever had.
It tasted better than the south Indian food udupi serves in India.
Highly recommended

data.title: Excellent South Indian food!
data.text: All 5 of us were not that keen on Indian food, but the aroma emanating from this restaurant got us in, and we decided to go for various types of dosas, an uttapam, and some methu vadas.  All of the items were cooked to perfection and served well.  The portions were big, so despite being thoroughly sated, we had some leftovers.  Sambhar and all the chutneys were yummy!

data.title: Go for the food, not the ambiance
data.text: You might look in the door and think, "This place is small and very basic", but be sure to sit down and order!  Like our group did, perhaps you'd like to try vegetable utthapam (thick pancake made from rice & lentil flour, studded with onions and vegetables), paneer makhani (Indian cheese cubes in spiced tomato gravy), poori (Puffy fried bread), masala dosa (crispy crepe stuffed with spiced potatoes), chili cheese dosa (stuffed with chili peppers and cheese), spinach masala dosa (stuffed with curried spinach), samosa chaat (samosas cut up and topped with chickpea curry, yogurt and chutney), lassis (plain or mango yogurt shakes), and masala chai tea (spiced tea with cream).   As we dined, various ones kept exclaiming over the fine flavor blends grabbed by their taste buds.  The lassis' were the perfect beverage to calm any extra hot spices.  The prices were great and the servers attentive.  This was great exposure to South Indian cuisine.

data.title: Busy but delicious !
data.text: On my latest trip to Berkeley I was walking by and then decided to give this place a shot! Needless to say I was very impressed. Despite it being an incredibly crowded evening and lots of people bustling in and out within 10 minutes of putting in my to go order of coconut curry vegetables in hand and I was out the door. Everyone in there seem to be genuinely enjoying their evening and I certainly enjoyed my meal! It is some of the better cuisine I have enjoyed in that area.

data.title: Great dosa - close to campus
data.text:
I stopped in for Mysore Masala Dosa during a visit to UC Berkeley.  So good to have my favorite treat!  I don't get to India often enough.  I've had a lot of dosa, over the years, and this one was pretty darn good. 

The atmosphere is simple, the service was good, the prices reasonable.  The bathroom was not especially pleasant or clean :-(.

data.title: Average food, not worth the hype
data.text:
This place came highly recommended to me, and I was very disappointed after trying the food here. Maybe it was just a bad day for the restaurant or something? It's probably worth another try just to make sure, but the food was average at best.

I had samosas as an appetizer, which were decent. My wife and I had masala dosas, which were also decent. It was the entree that soured the experience. My aloo matar curry tasted bad -- not decent, acceptable, or blah, but bad. It had no flavor to it, and tasted nothing like similar dishes I've had at other restaurants. My wife's khadi bhindi curry also didn't taste good, and she typically LOVES Indian food. Like I said previously, it may be worth giving this place another try based on reputation, but based on my experience, I would not come back here.

data.title: Good food, good service.
data.text: If you like Indian, eat at this place on University Ave. Try the Chana Battura, Utthapam and Dosa, or any of the other standard Indian dishes, appetizers, and naans.

data.title: a true gem!
data.text:
A chain with eight other locations, Udupi Palace is a great place close to UC Berkeley 

Specializing in dosa, a stuffed crepe-like dish, they also have uthapam, a pancake-style variation of dosa, in addition to more traditional Indian curries, such as chana masala and vegetable curry. They also have two tomato-base soups. For a visual as well as a gastronomic treat, try the 5-foot paper masala dosa! Served with a delectable sambar and a three different chutneys, including a lovely coconut chutney, this is a feast for the eyes, mouth, and stomach. It goes really well with their mango juice, too. 

With an all-veg menu, large portions, reasonable prices, great service, nice ambiance, and a good mix of people, Udupi Palace is an instant classic and a new favorite.

data.title: Very pleased and satisfied
data.text:
When we were here last my husband wasn't impressed with the dosas but I persuaded him to try it again as we were both really craving dosas.
My Masala dosa was cooked to perfection, crispy just as I asked and the best really that I have had for a long time since we moved back from India.
Everyone, even dear husband, at our table was completely satisfied.

data.title: Should have done more research
data.text: Perhaps if I'd known that there's be no meat dishes... and that we'd have to pay with cash.....and if the website had listed the correct address we'd have been in a more receptive mood.   Still, the food was, in the end, unremarkable.

data.title: This is my favorite!
data.text: I love Udupi Palace. It has delicious, affordable, spicy South Indian food. The thali is the best - a little bit a everything to taste, including dessert. I also think the dosas are delicious. They have great hours, and the staff is friendly. It's not fancy, but if you want some super tasty and affordable food, check out Udupi!

data.title: didnt like the food or location
data.text: i really did not care for the food. i dont see why people love this place, maybe i prefer north indian food better or something. it is somewhat away from campus

data.title: Seriously good Masala Dosa
data.text: I live in Denver but I'm from the SF Bay Area and am quite picky about my dosa.  Despite growing up in Berkeley, I'd somehow managed to avoid Udupi all these years.  We got dosa takeout tonight and it was so ridiculously good.  The potatoes are tender enough to melt in your mouth.  The dosa itself is savory and thin, which I prefer.  Sometimes places make them too thick and then they get soggy from the filling.  I am in town for 4 more days and you can bet I'll be going back to Udupi before I leave.  Yum.
